data.title: Little cafe by the tracks - amazing food
data.text: Order the Chili Geuritas (sp?) - you will NOT regret!  Delicious. Atmosphere is authentic and fun.  Easy to get to.  Quite an experience.

data.title: Overseasoned
data.text: The restaurant itself as far as ambiance was fine. However, all of our food was too salty. The food would be much better if the chefs would have a lighter hand with the salt.

data.title: Great Food; So So Location
data.text: I've never seen Chilaquiles like this before but the flavors were spot on. The location is in an industrial area and probably not somewhere I'd want to be after dark, but I'll be back for lunch.

owner_response.author: ElMexicalICafe, Owner at El Mexicali Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for stopping in and for taking the time to leave your review. We're glad you enjoyed our recipe for Chilaquiles. We hope to see you again soon for lunch.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: The original but the other one is better
data.text: Good what kind of run-down I don't think the cooks are not as good as their second store plus it's hard to park there at times get there early place is super small in the bathroom could be cleaned a little bit more often

owner_response.author: ElMexicalICafe, Owner at El Mexicali Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for visiting us and for taking the time to leave us a review. We clean the restrooms frequently, but we'll make sure we double check the restrooms during especially busy weekends. Thanks, again, for your feedback.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Hit The Spot
data.text: Delicious and authentic Mexican food. Friendly service and you never have to wait long for a table.  Can't ask for more.  Try their stuffed shrimp peppers, add a little soy sauce Yum!

owner_response.author: ElMexicalICafe, Owner at El Mexicali Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the kind review, Jessica! We're so glad you loved the Chiles Gueritos.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: lunch stop.
data.text: Service is great one of the original mexican restaruant in this valley,good prices too,enjoy.plenty of parking ,about a quarter mile off the freeway.

owner_response.author: ElMexicalICafe, Owner at El Mexicali Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for stopping by for lunch. We're so glad you enjoyed everything.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: not the mexican food we had hoped for
data.text: Very disappointed in iceberg lettuce, tasteless flats, and dull beans.  Would not go again despite cheerful service

owner_response.author: ElMexicalICafe, Owner at El Mexicali Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We appreciate your feedback. We're sorry you didn't receive the 5-star experience during your recent visit that our regulars have come to love us for. We hope you'll give us another try when you're in the area.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Lunch stop on the way to Arizona
data.text: Delicious authentic Mexican food. Rice just like my mother-in-law taught me to make. We had the chili relleno and taquitos .

owner_response.author: ElMexicalICafe, Owner at El Mexicali Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you, Linda! So happy to hear it reminded you of home.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Mexican food tradition, no hassle, no awkwardness just go here!
data.text: Family run business (without the pathological need to tell so all the time) Tried out and tested recipes. Sure - the waitress forgot our order of a guaca mehicana, and no formal excuse was issued but hey - once we adressed the issue it landed on the table swiftly so no biggy. Temperature was unbelievably high outside for a couple of scandinavians, but the cross town detour was well worth it. Apart from the food I love this kind of service - neutral at first and then towards the end of the evening a little more inquisitive and personal. I would definately recommend  going here, even if it being a detour!

owner_response.author: ElMexicalICafe, Owner at El Mexicali Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for paying us a visit! We're so happy you had a great time, and hope to see you again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: One of a kind
data.text: The location on Indio Blvd is historic.  Next to a train track, this small location makes it cozy and special.  The people are great.  Must have the stuffed pepper appetizer, like nothing I have ever had and it's terrific.

owner_response.author: ElMexicalICafe, Owner at El Mexicali Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the kind review, Dennis! We appreciate it so much. We look forward to seeing you again soon
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great food
data.text: The food always tastes great and freshly made. I have tried other Mexican restaurants nearby and this one is simply the best. The recipies are from the norwest states of México.

owner_response.author: ElMexicalICafe, Owner at El Mexicali Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for leaving your review. We're glad you enjoy the authenticity of our Mexican food and hope to see you again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best Mexican Food in the Desert
data.text: Ive eaten here a dozen times and it is always very good. I love the stuffed peppers, they are out of this world. the staff is friendly and makes you feel welcome. The harpist adds a really nice touch. try it, you'll like it

owner_response.author: ElMexicalICafe, Owner at El Mexicali Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review, Donald. We'll be sure to let our sister, Laura, know that you enjoyed your experience at El Mexicali Cafe II on Monroe St.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: simply the best
data.text: Service excellent, food.. to die for try the juaritos, margos perfect restaurant very clean  will be a regular here for darn sure!!

owner_response.author: ElMexicalICafe, Owner at El Mexicali Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for letting us know how we did. It's wonderful to hear you enjoyed the Chiles Gueritos and Margaritas. We look forward to seeing you again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: El Mexicali
data.text: Found food to be very ordinary -- the type you find in most small, casual places.  Not bad but not worth a return visit for us.  The prices were reasonable.

owner_response.author: ElMexicalICafe, Owner at El Mexicali Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We appreciate your feedback and thank you for trying us out.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: If in Indio, California........
data.text:
We were fortunate that this gem of an eatery was recommended to us.  A no frills excellent restaurant where there is pride of ownnership and the food is to die for.  If you're looking for fake Mexican food with the wild colors on the walls and fake parrots on swings, this ain't it.

We tried the local favorite, the stuffed chilies with shrimp.  The best appetizer I've ever had.  I am Hispanic, so I've had a few Mexican meals.  We were greeted by Lupe, the most friendly gal you'll ever meet.  She reminded me of an aunt, long gone.  The kind of gal that wants you to sit down and eat.  "You look hungry" .  She showed us exactly how to prepare our chiles, before eating.  6 to a plate.  A little soy, a little lemon and a dash of mayo.  My husband also tried the bean burrito with real retried beans made from pintos, not kidney beans.  I had a carnie asada soft taco that was just like the street tacos I used to get in Ensenada.  Muy Bueno.  We will be back.

owner_response.author: ElMexicalICafe, Owner at El Mexicali Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for leaving us a review! We're so glad to hear that Lupe helped to create a great experience for you, as did the atmosphere of our cozy restaurant and the food. We look forward to seeing you again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: The BEST and most AUTHENTIC Mexican Restaurant in the Coachella Valley!
data.text: I moved to Rancho Mirage (Palm Springs area) several months ago and stumbled upon El Mexicali completely by chance... And, boy-oh-boy I'm happy I did!  If you want really excellent, fresh, home-cooked Mexican food -- i.e. not Americanized Mexican food -- then, look no further.  I believe El Mexicali has 3 different locations.  This was the first (think it's been around for years) and it's the only one I have tried.  The restaurant is in Indio, which is a very easy drive from the West Valley and sits near some fairly heavily used train tracks off of Indio Boulevard. (Sort of fun to hear the trains go by -- not unpleasant in any way.)  The restaurant is extremely clean and has 20 tables or so.  The staff couldn't be nicer... Helpful too as many of the dishes were new to me.  On my first visit, I ordered the Costillas de Puerco con Nopales (Pork Short Ribs with Cactus) and a small bowl of Menudo (only served on Sat/Sun) and both were AMAZING!  My second visit was 3 weeks later and all the waitresses remembered me.  Food was just as good as the first visit.  They will see me many. many more times in the future.  Can't recommend it highly enough!  Totally worth the drive... You'll be flying high on the way back ;-)

owner_response.author: ElMexicalICafe, Owner at El Mexicali Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Welcome to the El Mexicali Cafe family! Thanks so much for taking the time to leave us a review and for recommending us. We're so happy to hear that you had a wonderful first experience with us. We look forward to welcoming you over and over again each time you visit!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fun little Mexican place!
data.text: We would never have gone here if it were not for a friend's recommendation but so glad we tried it! The shrimp appetizer is very unique and very good. The waitress told us how to prepare it which was good because it really enhanced the flavor. I tried the chicken tostada which came with beans and rice and was very tasty. My husband had a chicken and a beef taco and he said they were very good as well and were also served with rice and beans. We will definitely be back!

owner_response.author: ElMexicalICafe, Owner at El Mexicali Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We appreciate you giving us a try, and we appreciate your friends for providing you with the recommendation. Thanks so much for your review. See you next time!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Superb little place. A foodie delight
data.text: As we pulled up we were unsure if the place was open, pushing the door open we were greeted by signing and a busy place. Well, the door was open, so in we went. Oh boy, so glad we did. Fun place, and wonderful staff served and serenaded the place all night. It was all good. Particularly their shrimp starter. I'd like to say a special thanks to the server that looked after us, and showed us how to eat this wonderful finger food. Definitely coming back on our next visit.

owner_response.author: ElMexicalICafe, Owner at El Mexicali Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for recommending our Chiles Gueritos and for trying it with soy sauce and mayo, like we do in Mexicali. We look forward to welcoming you again next time.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Authentic Mexican Food
data.text: We tried several Mexican restaurants during our stay in Indio this Winter. This restaurant was so entertaining and fabulous food. Being serenaded during your dinner was awkward at first but I totally got into the vibe and was wooed by the singer. He was so good and I must say very easy on the eyes!  Now back to the food-burritos were excellent as was my margarita. I usually get chicken and my husband goes for the beef. I must say the meat they used in his was absolutely delicious. It was like eating a super tender beef roast. If you never have had a Cadillac Margarita treat yourself to pure deliciousness!  Highly recommend this MaMa's restaurant. She has a winner going here.

owner_response.author: ElMexicalICafe, Owner at El Mexicali Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for visiting us while you were in town. It's wonderful to hear you enjoyed the food and the live music. We hope to see you the next time you're in Indio.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very good long time Indio restaurant
data.text: The food is very good, service is usually good but average when they are busy, which is a majority of the time. We eat here often because you feel like your home when we come to eat here. Same great taste and the same familiar faces just feel good.

owner_response.author: ElMexicalICafe, Owner at El Mexicali Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave your review. We're glad you feel like you're a part of our family every time you visit. See you again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response
